title: Hawaii could be threatened by tropical cyclone in Pacific Ocean
message:

There is a much lower probability of reaching Category 1 hurricane strength, with sustained winds of at least 74 mph.

title: One year since Hilary : Here what happened when the storm hit
message:

For the first time ever for California, the National Hurricane Center issued a tropical storm watch, and later a tropical storm warning.

title: Disaster declaration approved for Vermont for July flooding from remnants of Beryl - LocalNews8 . com
message:

title: Puerto Rico Insurers to Absorb Hurricane Ernesto Losses : AM Best
message:
Losses in Puerto Rico from Hurricane Ernesto are expected to be absorbed by the island’s domiciled insurers, according to industry rating AM Best.
The rating agency said premiums in Puerto Rico had been flat for years prior to hurricanes Maria and Irma in 2017.
Also, unaffiliated Puerto Rico-domiciled companies have accounted for a growing share of total Puerto Rico NPW.
Additionally, premium ceded for the unaffiliated Puerto Rico-domiciled companies to reinsurance companies has more than doubled since 2017.

title: Storm Warnings in Place Across Europe , From Northern Greece to Poland
message:
Thunderstorm alerts are in place for a swath of Europe from Poland and Hungary to Italy and Greece.

Serbia and Kosovo face similar alerts, while much of Italy is under a yellow storm warning.

title: Met Office yellow weather warnings across united kingdom on Thursday as  summer air mixes with Hurricane Ernesto
message:
Yellow weather warnings for rain and wind have been issued across the UK for Thursday as humid summer air mixes with the remains of Hurricane Ernesto.
Up to 6in (150mm) of rain and strong winds of up to 60mph could affect some areas over a 24-hour period, with flooding, dangerous coastal conditions and power cuts possible, the Met Office said.
The forecaster has issued a yellow warning for rain for the western half of Scotland, covering the Highlands, south-west Scotland and Strathclyde, from 11am on Wednesday to 8am on Thursday.
Separate yellow warnings for wind covering northern Wales and northern England, including both Cumbria and Northumberland, have been issued from 1am to 9am on Thursday.
The Scottish Environment Protection Agency has issued 21 flood alerts, meaning flooding is expected, across the Orkney and the Western Isles, and coastal areas in Moray and Dumfries and Galloway.

title: Gilma becomes the 2nd hurricane of the eastern Pacific season and is forecast to stay away from land
message:
Gilma becomes the 2nd hurricane of the eastern Pacific season and is forecast to stay away from landThis image provided by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration shows Tropical Storm Gilma, at center, Monday, Aug. 19, 2024.
(National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration via AP)MEXICO CITY (AP) — Gilma became the second hurricane of this year's eastern Pacific Ocean season early Wednesday and is forecast to remain away from land.
The Category 1 storm was located about 935 miles (1,504 kilometers) west-southwest of the southern tip of the Baja California peninsula of Mexico, according to the National Hurricane Center in Miami.
Gilma had strengthened to tropical storm status on Sunday.
Hurricane-force winds extended outward up to 25 miles (40 km) from the center and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 140 miles (225 km).

title: Could Hawaii be impacted by developing tropical cyclones in the Pacific ?
message:
Could Hawaii be impacted by developing tropical cyclones in the Pacific?
Direct strikes on the archipelago are rare, but periods of increased waves and wind are more common with passing tropical cyclones.
In nearly all cases, these features act as barriers to tropical cyclones approaching the islands, rapidly leading to their weakening or dissipation.
NOAA’s Central Pacific Hurricane Center, in coordination with the agency’s Climate Prediction Center, expects between one and four tropical cyclones to traverse the ocean, which is below the typical four to five tropical depressions, tropical storms and hurricanes.

title: Western Alaska Yupik village floods as river rises from a series of storms
message:
ANCHORAGE, Alaska (AP) — Storm-battered residents in the western Alaska village of Napakiak were preparing for the third storm in a week Tuesday, days after a minister had to use a front loader to free people from flooded homes.
Napakiak, a Yup’ik village of about 350 residents in the Yukon-Kuskokwim Delta, was flooded Sunday after heavy rains swelled the Kuskokwim River.
It caught everyone by surprise because it wasn’t the normal spring or fall flooding, which residents prepare for, Hale said.
It’s so pervasive in Napakiak that the village school had to be closed this year because it’s close to falling into the river.
The weekend storms caused coastal flooding in several other western Alaska communities, but there were no reports of health issues or major property damage, state emergency officials said.

title: Valley fever cases rise to record high in California in 2023 : CDPH
message:
California is on track to surpass last year’s record-high cases of valley fever, a potentially debilitating infection caused by inhaling fungal spores in dirt or dust.
Brontë Wittpenn/The ChronicleCalifornia in 2023 reported a record-high number of valley fever cases — a potentially debilitating infection caused by inhaling fungal spores in dirt or dust — and 2024 is on track to surpass that, state health officials said Tuesday.
In 2023, nearly 9,300 cases of valley fever were reported statewide, about triple the number from a decade ago, according to state data.
“These were the highest first and second quarter for valley fever that we’ve ever had in the state of California,” Cooksey said.
But California health officials have noted surges in valley fever roughly two years after major droughts — followed by a wet winter — since the early 2000s.

title: Conway residents still dealing with river flooding after Debby
message:
CONWAY, S.C. (WBTW) — Waccamaw River flooding caused by Tropical Storm Debby forced many Conway residents to move their cars, call out of work, temporarily move or a combination of all three.
The entrances to Pitch Landing Road and Lees Landing Circle are currently blocked off by police cars.
Some families trying to get to Conway’s Riverfront Park had to turn around after realizing how bad the flooding was.
Although the river level is slowly falling, it’s still at major flood stage and will remain that way until about Friday.
The Stonebraker family is from Aynor and came to check out the flooding for themselves.

title: Smart health facilities triumph over Hurricane Beryl
message:
Hurricane Beryl provided a defining moment for the Mandeville and Santa Cruz health centres, which were two of the four facilities upgraded to ‘gold standard’ under the Strengthening Healthcare Facilities in the Caribbean (Smart Hospitals Programme Phase 2).
Notably, preliminary assessments conducted after the storm revealed minimal damage to both health centres.
“Having weathered the storm, these Smart Health Centres underscore the necessity of robust healthcare infrastructure in regions vulnerable to natural disasters.
The Smart facilities serve as a model for adaptation, essential in strengthening and safeguarding public health systems amid climate uncertainty,” said Ian Stein, PAHO/WHO Jamaica representative.
For her part, Judith Slater, British High Commissioner to Jamaica, said, “I was heartened, but not surprised, to learn that the Mandeville and Santa Cruz ‘Smart’ health centres withstood Hurricane Beryl’s worst to emerge with minimal damage.

title: Tropical depression dumps heavy rain in southern South Korea and Seoul area
message:
An entrance to the Cheonggye stream is closed in preparation for an approaching Tropical Storm Jongdari in Seoul, South Korea, Wednesday, Aug. 21, 2024.
(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A tropical depression dumped heavy rain in southern South Korea and the populous Seoul region Wednesday after weakening from a tropical storm.
Some southern parts of the mainland and the island of Jeju recorded 10 to 17 centimeters (3.9 to 6.6 inches) of rain.
Some areas in the capital region saw 10 to 12 centimeters (3.9 to 4.7 inches) of rain Wednesday.
The depression that was once Tropical Storm Jongdari made landfall Wednesday morning, and South Korea’s weather agency said the system was continuing to weaken.

title: Tropical depression dumps heavy rain in southern South Korea and Seoul area

Some areas in the capital region saw 10 to 12 centimeters (3.9 to 4.7 inches) of rain Wednesday.
The depression that was once Tropical Storm Jongdari made landfall Wednesday morning, and South Korea’s weather agency said the system was continuing to weaken.

title: Sunday massive rainfall may have been most in Connecticut history : NWS
message:
The National Weather Service is looking at the possibility that Sunday's historic rain event set a record for the most rainfall ever in Connecticut over a 24-hour period.
A State Climate Extremes Committee, including representatives from the National Weather Service in New York and National Weather Service climate experts will be reviewing two 24-hour rainfall measurements from Sunday.
The two totals were reported by private home weather stations in Oxford.
One measured 14.83" of rain and the other measured 13.5", according to the National Weather Service.
The NWS experts will examine the home weather stations at both locations to determine if they are in compliance with National Weather Service measurement guidelines and specifications.

title: On August 20 , This Texas City Was Erased by a Massive Hurricane
message:
In the mid-1800s, Galveston was one of the largest ports in the U.S., and by far the largest port in Texas.
However, there was another Texas city that was considered a rival port.
But, between 1845 - 1875, Indianola was a bustling port town on Matagorda Bay that boasted over 5,000 residents by the 1870s.
Google Maps Google Maps loading...Hurricane One-Two PunchOn September 16, 1875, an estimated Category 3 hurricane (winds 111-130 mph, storm surge 9-12 feet) took aim on Indianola.
However, on August 20, 1886, a Category 4 hurricane (winds 131-155 mph, storm surge 13-18 feet) decimated Indianola.

title: Tens of thousands remain without power in Puerto Rico , a week after tropical storm swiped the island
message:
Electric workers carry out repairs in the community of Puerta de Tierra after the passage of Tropical Storm Ernesto in San Juan, Puerto Rico, Thursday, Aug. 15, 2024.
(AP Photo/Alejandro Granadillo)SAN JUAN – Tens of thousands of customers remained without power across Puerto Rico on Tuesday, a week after Ernesto swiped the U.S. territory as a tropical storm.
Up to 70,000 clients could be temporarily left in the dark late Tuesday, and another 90,000 were already hit Monday by a manual reduction in power to Puerto Rico's grid.
During the storm, which spun past the island last Tuesday and Wednesday, a peak of 750,000 clients were without power.
Puerto Rico’s Energy Bureau questioned why the average outage duration per customer increased by 9% from fiscal year 2023 to 2024, for a total of 1,448 minutes.

title: Flooding closes two residence halls at Stony Brook University , forcing a housing reshuffle
message:

Ammann and Gray residence halls "will need extensive repairs and cannot be safely occupied," the university said on its website.

Stony Brook has 33 residence halls with nearly 9,000 undergraduates living on campus.

title: India to spend $300 million to mitigate floods , conserve water in big cities
message:

Flooding, often fatal, is common in Indian cities every monsoon as rapid urbanisation devours city lakes and waste clogs drains.

title: President Biden approves Vermont major disaster declaration request
message:

title: Natural disasters and insurance : Some homes becoming uninsurable , but all may not be lost - Christopher Whitehead
message:
Cautious insurersThere’s no general requirement in New Zealand that insurers cover anyone’s home, or that anyone’s home actually be insured.
When homeowners do get insurance, the risk of certain losses from natural disasters is automatically covered by the Natural Hazards Commission (previously known as the Earthquake Commission).
The insurer may even offer “parametric” insurance, which pays out less than traditional insurance, but faster.
While parametric insurance is relatively new worldwide, it’s an efficient solution for managing the risk of natural disaster damage.
Natural disaster wouldn’t have to mean financial disaster as much as it does today.

title: Remnants of Hurricane Ernesto to hit Donegal tonight
message:
THE remnants of Hurricane Ernesto are set to hit Donegal tonight.
Hurricane Ernesto is forecasted to track eastwards and combine with low pressure over Iceland today, passing between Ireland and Iceland tonight.
As this low pressure system tracks past the north-west, it will bring a spell of rather windy and wet weather across the country.
The low pressure system will coincide with very high spring tides tonight and Thursday.
The combination of these very high tides with strong winds will result in high waves and forecasted surge may lead to coastal flooding and wave overtopping.

title: Hurricane season could take a breather after Ernesto . It wont last long
message:
CNN —Tropical activity in an unusually active hurricane season will take a breather after Ernesto, but forecasters don’t believe it will last long.
CNN WeatherThis isn’t surprising because the climatological peak of hurricane season is just a few weeks away.
Only 2005 and 1980 had a more active start to hurricane season, according to Michael Lowry, a hurricane expert.
The busiest part of hurricane season typically starts in mid-August, peaks around September 10 and persists into mid-October.
This season has already racked up about half of the activity an entire normal season would produce with plenty of tropical activity to come.

title: Fukuoka Observatory Urges Review of Nankai Trough Earthquake Info
message:
The Fukuoka Meteorological Observatory highlighted the need for a review of the government’s approach to disseminating information related to the Nankai Trough Earthquake.
This comes after the release of temporary earthquake information following the magnitude 7.1 earthquake in the Hyuga-nada region on August 8.
During a regular press conference on August 20, the observatory emphasized the importance of ongoing preparedness for large-scale earthquakes, as the Nankai Trough region remains highly susceptible.
Shuichiro Fukumitsu, head of the Earthquake and Volcano Division, noted that public awareness of the temporary earthquake information issued for the first time was insufficient, indicating a need for more widespread educational efforts.
He also called for a comprehensive review of the government’s information dissemination strategies, incorporating feedback from local governments and other stakeholders.

And it warns that the extreme temperatures seen that year were already equivalent to some climate projections for 2050.
"It is inescapable that extreme heat and moisture deficits enabled the record-breaking 2023 fire season," says the study, published Tuesday in the journal Nature Communications.
"In 2023, we had the most extreme fire weather conditions on record over much of the country," said Piyush Jain, a scientist with Natural Resources Canada.
The 2023 combination of extreme heat and drought could be a precursor of what is to come, Jain said.

title: Malawi receives an insurance payout of $11 . 2 million for El Nino - linked drought disaster - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
The Malawian government has received an insurance payout of $11.2 million for a crippling El Nino-linked drought that led the southern African nation to declare a state of disaster earlier this year.
The payout was given to Malawi this month, the African Development Bank said Monday.
Malawi had a drought insurance policy through the bank and the African Risk Capacity Group, an agency of the African Union.
The funds will support food assistance to around 235,000 households in some of Malawi’s hardest-hit regions and also help with direct relief payments to more than 100,000 households, the African Development Bank said.
Zambia and Zimbabwe also declared states of disaster and have asked for international help, and Mozambique, Zambia and Zimbabwe were expected to receive drought insurance payouts by September, the African Development Bank said.

title: The deadly cost of America housing crisis
message:
In some parts of the country, the only affordable homes for middle-class households are in areas prone to disasters.
Because of our collective refusal to build more housing where it is most needed, millions of people live with elevated climate risk.
Where I live, across the bay from San Francisco, thermometers climbed into the mid-80s — not exactly pleasant for perspiration-prone Ashkenazi men such as myself, but tolerable.
Compare homebuilding in Houston (average daily July high of 95 degrees) with homebuilding in San Francisco.
To be sure, income and climate risk are not perfectly correlated; several wealthy enclaves are at risk of coastal erosion.

title: Tricky time for farmers - survey
message:
Beef + Lamb New Zealand has released its annual stock number survey which showed a notable decline in both sheep and cattle numbers as of June 30.
Sheep numbers were estimated to have decreased by 4.3%, down to 23.31 million, with breeding ewe numbers falling by 2.9% and trading sheep stock numbers down 7.9%.
Beef cattle numbers dropped 6.6% in Otago and increased 5.1% in Southland.
The number of beef cattle might recover more quickly as prices have remained strong for beef and farmers have been switching from sheep to cattle.
While sheep numbers had been declining slowly, afforestation had accelerated that sharply and also driven down cattle numbers.

title: The Engineer - Severn Trent unveils 25m deep storm overflow tank
message:
Severn Trent has unveiled a 25m deep by 25m wide storm overflow storage tank designed to protect residents of Stroud from potential flooding and prevent spills into rivers.
The Stroud Sewer Strategy project has delivered a 7,400m3 capacity concrete-lined tank built with partners Galliford Try.
Its ‘smart controls’ will hold storm water back during severe weather events and return it back to the water company’s treatment works when rainfall has subsided.
Severn Trent added that a new concrete lid will be installed on the overflow storage tank in the coming weeks.
In July 2024 Severn Trent announced a £450m programme to cut spills from other storm overflows at 900 sites across the Midlands.

Travis County is 1 out of nearly 115 counties under a burn ban in the state, according to the Texas A&M Forest Service.

title: Monsoon rains cause widespread flooding across Pakistan
message:
Monsoon rains cause widespread flooding across PakistanPakistan Pakistan Monsoon rains cause widespread flooding across PakistanThe downpour brought relief from heat as citizens enjoyed respite from humidityFollow on Updated On: Wed, 21 Aug 2024 11:44:34 PKTLAHORE (Dunya News) – The monsoon rains have wreaked havoc in various parts of the country, including the provincial capital Lahore, with low-lying areas submerged due to water accumulation.
In Lahore, heavy rainfall after midnight on Wednesday turned Lakshmi Chowk, The Mall, Jail Road, Baghbanpura, Tajpura, Iqbal Town, Chowburji and other low-lying areas into ponds.
Elsewhere, Muridke, Chashma, and surrounding areas experienced torrential rains accompanied by strong winds, while Balochistan faced severe flooding due to monsoon rains.
In Khuzdar, intense rain with thunderstorm caused rivers and streams to overflow, resulting in a flood situation in rural areas.
Islamabad and Rawalpindi also saw substantial rainfall, causing waterlogging in low-lying areas, streets, and neighborhoods.

title: WATCH : Agriculture Ministry hands out supplies to fisherfolk in Parottee , St Elizabeth
message:
KINGSTON, Jamaica — Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Mining, Floyd Green on Friday handed out supplies to fisherfolk in Parottee, St Elizabeth as part of the ministry’s Hurricane Beryl Fisheries Recovery Programme.
Parottee is one of the communities that remains without electricity since the passing of Hurricane Beryl on July 3.
Speaking at the voucher handover ceremony at the Parottee Seventh-day Adventist Church, Green said, “This is a part of our overarching response programme.
“The people who have not yet been reached please visit our offices, leave your information, we will do our verification processes and we will try to help.
We will build back quickly and we will build back stronger,” Green said.

title: Watch : Connecticut home collapses amid historic flooding
message:
The Brief A house in Oxford, Connecticut, collapsed due to flash flooding, with dramatic footage capturing the moment as the structure was swept away by rushing water.
The flooding claimed the lives of two other residents, marking the event as both tragic and unprecedented for the area.
A house in Connecticut gave away and collapsed Monday after enduring flash flooding over the weekend, with many people calling the story "historic" and "unprecedented."
A home in Connecticut collapsed after flash flooding.
Tragically, officials said the flooding took the lives of two other residents who were swept away by the flood.

title: Nevada wildfire causes rail and power outages , but crews halt flame progress
message:
Nevada wildfire causes rail and power outages, but crews halt flames’ progressScott Sonner / AP, fileWINNEMUCCA — A wildfire has forced the suspension of rail service in northern Nevada and left about several thousand rural residents without power.
But fire officials said Tuesday that night crews had halted the progress of the flames, which charred more than a square mile (2.6 square kilometers) of terrain and temporarily shut down part of Interstate 80.
But firefighters had contained about 50% of the blaze by nightfall, the land management agency said.
The utility NV Energy reported that more than 3,000 residents remained without electricity into the evening after power lines were shut down as a precaution in the afternoon.
Multiple aircraft, including a large airtanker and a helicopter, were assisting 20 fire engines and crews on the ground, the Bureau of Land Management said.

title: Sicily yacht sinking : live update
message:
Divers searching for six missing people following the sinking of a superyacht off Sicily have found two bodies, a source close to the search told AFP Wednesday.
